# Issue Templates Guide

Thank you for contributing to Sentinel! Please use the appropriate issue template when creating a new issue:

## ğŸ“‹ Available Templates

### ğŸ› [Bug Report](bug_report.md)
Use this for reporting bugs or issues with existing functionality.

**Include:**
- Steps to reproduce
- Expected vs. actual behavior
- Environment details (OS, Node version, etc.)
- Error logs or screenshots

### âœ¨ [Feature Request](feature_request.md)
Use this to suggest new features or improvements.

**Include:**
- Problem statement
- Proposed solution and alternatives
- Use cases and benefits
- Affected components

### ğŸ“š [Documentation](documentation.md)
Use this to report missing or unclear documentation.

**Include:**
- Location of the issue
- What's missing/confusing
- Suggested improvements
- Related links

### âš¡ [Performance Issue](performance.md)
Use this for performance problems (slow dashboard, high resource usage, etc.).

**Include:**
- Affected component(s)
- Reproduction steps
- Performance metrics
- Environment details

## ğŸš« What NOT to do

- **Don't open issues for questions** â†’ Use [Discussions](https://github.com/SKfaizan-786/sentinel-devops-agent/discussions)
- **Don't open public issues for security vulnerabilities** â†’ Use [Security Advisories](https://github.com/SKfaizan-786/sentinel-devops-agent/security/advisories/new)
- **Don't duplicate existing issues** â†’ Search first before creating
- **Don't leave incomplete information** â†’ Fill out all relevant sections

## ğŸ“ Issue Naming Convention

Use descriptive titles with prefixes:
- `[BUG] Dashboard freezes on large metric updates`
- `[FEATURE] Dark mode support for dashboard`
- `[DOCS] Missing API endpoint documentation`
- `[PERFORMANCE] Slow query when filtering 1000+ services`

## âœ… Checklist Before Submitting

- [ ] I've searched for duplicate issues
- [ ] I'm using the correct template
- [ ] I've provided all required information
- [ ] I've included logs/screenshots where applicable
- [ ] I've followed the naming convention

## ğŸ¯ What Happens Next?

1. **Triage**: Maintainers will review and label your issue
2. **Discussion**: Team may ask clarifying questions
3. **Resolution**: Issue will be assigned and worked on
4. **PR**: A pull request will reference and close your issue

## ğŸ’¡ Tips for Better Issues

- Be specific and concise
- One issue = one problem
- Include minimal reproducible examples
- Provide environment context (Docker, K8s, cloud provider, etc.)
- For bugs: attach logs/traces/screenshots
- For features: explain the use case and benefits
